Package com.amonson.config_location

Class ConfigLoader

java.lang.Object
com.amonson.config_location.ConfigLoader
public class ConfigLoader extends Object

Description for class ConfigLoader which finds and opens configuration to multiple sources. These sources are:

system
/etc/application_name.d/
custom
/custom_path/ Note: this overrides use of the application_name in the path
user
${HOME}/.config/application_name.d/
redis
Redis Server

There is a definite order to the search for a specific configuration locations and and values can be overridden:

  1. user: This allows the user of an application to override all or some of the default configuration.
  2. system: This allows the system install to override any multi-system redis server configuration.
  3. redis: This allows the multi-system redis server to be the default source for configuration. Format must be JSON.
  4. custom: This specifies a specific folder with the configuration files in it.

Configuration files can be in one of 2 formats, JSON or YAML. The files must end with either a ".json" or ".yml".

Redis configuration if used must be found in /etc/application_name.{json|yml}.

NOTE: This class only works on Linux based OS distributions for filesystem config files but will work against Redis.

  • Constructor Details

    • ConfigLoader

      public ConfigLoader(String applicationName, org.apache.logging.log4j.core.Logger logger) throws PropStoreFactoryException
      Create a configuration file locator object for finding application configuration files or other streams.
      Parameters:
      applicationName - This is the application name that is used as the base filename for the indirect configuration file in /etc. i.e. /etc/applicationName.conf.
      logger - Logger created from LogManager.
      Throws:
      PropStoreFactoryException - when the PropStore fails to load and parse the configuration file.
      IllegalArgumentException - if any of the input arguments are null or applicationName is blank.

  • Method Details

    • getConfigurationByName

      public PropMap getConfigurationByName(String name)
      Get the PropMap parsed from the specified configuration name.
      Parameters:
      name - The base name for the configuration to retrieve, this does not include the extension like ".json" or ".yml".
      Returns:
      The map of the merged configurations. If there was no configuration found the PropMap will be empty but not null.
